content.en: Optimizing IVF Outcomes: Scientists have developed algorithms to improve the success rates of in vitro fertilization (IVF) and reduce the risk of complications. These algorithms help determine the timing and dosage of medications used in IVF, such as GnRH antagonists and FSH. By individualizing the treatment based on specific criteria and markers of ovarian reserve, these algorithms aim to optimize pregnancy outcomes and prevent ovarian hyperstimulation syndrome. The use of algorithms in IVF shows promise in improving the effectiveness and safety of assisted reproductive technologies.
content.da: Optimering af IVF-resultater: Forskere har udviklet algoritmer til at forbedre succesraterne for in vitro fertilisation (IVF) og reducere risikoen for komplikationer. Disse algoritmer hjælper med at bestemme timing og dosering af medicin brugt i IVF, såsom GnRH-antagonister og FSH. Ved at individualisere behandlingen baseret på specifikke kriterier og markører for ovariereserve, sigter disse algoritmer på at optimere graviditetsresultater og forhindre ovariel hyperstimulationssyndrom. Brug af algoritmer i IVF viser lovende takter i at forbedre effektiviteten og sikkerheden af assisterede reproduktionsteknologier.
